A variable-size matrix product state with a
translationally invariant representation is defined by:
rank 3 tensor such that for every superscript value x,
A weighted language P is a map of the form:
As P is often sparse, it can be useful to define
it in terms of its set of non-zero weighted words.
The set of rational weighted languages is the smallest set that
includes all languages nonzero for at most 1 word and which
is closed over finite applications of the rational operations.
sum of X(l)Y(r) for all l and r such that lr = w
NOTE: The above operation is well-defined if and only if X does not contain the empty string.
The weight of a walk through an automata is the product of all of the factors
along the path taken multiplied by the weight of the final state, and the
weight of an arbitrary string is the sum of the weights over all walks.

tspan.tspan: All variable-sized matrix product states can be
represented as a tree with rational operators at the
branches and weighted words at the leaves.

text.tspan: They allows you to study systems in the bulk
limit where the boundary effects are negligible.

A diverging language L is a pair of maps of the form:
No precondition on X or Y:
Precondition: Both X and Y contain only finite words
sum of X(x)Y(y) for all x, y such that xy = w
Precondition: X contains only finite, non-empty words
Precondition: X contains finite words and Y contains infinite words
X(xi) is non-zero for all i
sum of X(x) · Y(y)(n-|x|) for all xy = w
The set of rational diverging languages
is obtained by starting with the finite
weighted languages, closing them over the
rational operators just presented and then
taking only the words of infinite length.
x1x2...xk = w[0,n] where w[n,∞] in Xω
the sum of the weights of all paths of length n through the automata

tspan.tspan: starting at the initial state, where each path is multiplied by the weight of its
final state if w visits that state infinitely often and zero otherwise

text.tspan: For a given automata A and a given input word w, let:
vector that is everywhere zero except at the initial state
vector that equals zero at all states except those which
are visited infinitely often by w, in which case it is equal
to the corresponding final weight in A.

The set of rational diverging languages is equal

where X and Y are (finite) rational

tspan.tspan: All infinite matrix product states can be
represented as a tree with rational operators at the
branches and weighted words at the leaves.
